srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/interest-rates-768x432.png 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/interest-rates-300x169.png 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/interest-rates-1024x576.png 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/interest-rates-1536x864.png 1536w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/interest-rates-200x113.png 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/interest-rates-400x225.png 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/interest-rates-116x65.png 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/interest-rates-100x56.png 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/interest-rates-89x50.png 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/interest-rates-78x44.png 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/interest-rates.png 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 768px) 100vw, 768px" />			</div>							<figcaption>																<p class="source">Source: travellight / Shutterstock.com</p>									</figcaption>					</figure>							<div class="entry-content story">							<p>Interest rate cuts appear imminent in the coming months, though likely not as soon as March. However, I believe cuts could materialize in the second quarter or sometime thereafter. Regardless of the exact timing, consensus holds that rates will fall at some point this year. As details on the pace and scale of cuts emerge, investors can position themselves accordingly by looking into these rate cut stocks.</p><p>In my view, one smart approach is to buy stocks in companies hampered by high rates, but poised to thrive when the cost of capital declines. Many profitable firms are having trouble expanding margins amid lofty interest expenses. Additionally, debt loads seem disproportionately burdensome when rates spike, worrying investors. With cuts on the way, these companies could see earnings and valuation multiples expand.</p><p>We can also target sectors known to lag in high-rate environments but lead when the tide turns. As the market anticipates the economic stimulus of easing monetary policy, these groups tend to rally the most.</p><p>With this backdrop in mind, here are seven rate cut stocks to look into:</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading">Li Auto (LI)</h2><div id="2609476" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/li1600-2-300x169.png" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt="The steering wheel and dashboard inside Li Auto electric car. Interior of Li Auto EV. Li Auto Also known as Li Xiang, is a Chinese electric vehicle company. Rate Cut Stocks" class="alignright wp-image-2609476" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/li1600-2-300x169.png 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/li1600-2-1024x576.png 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/li1600-2-768x432.png 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/li1600-2-1536x864.png 1536w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/li1600-2-200x113.png 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/li1600-2-400x225.png 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/li1600-2-116x65.png 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/li1600-2-100x56.png 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/li1600-2-89x50.png 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/li1600-2-78x44.png 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/li1600-2.png 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source: Robert Way / Shutterstock.com</div></div><p><strong>Li Auto</strong> (NASDAQ:<span class="stock-ticker"><a href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/li-stock-quote/"><strong><u>LI</u></strong></a></span>) has been firing on all cylinders recently, and I expect it to accelerate significantly higher in the coming months as it seizes the spotlight among EV companies.</p><p>As a prime example, Li Auto just reported fourth-quarter revenue that grew 134% year-over-year to <a href="https://ir.lixiang.com/system/files-encrypted/nasdaq_kms/assets/2024/02/26/0-34-34/Li%20Auto%20Inc.%20Announces%20Unaudited%20Fourth%20Quarter%202023%20Financial%20Results.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener nofollow">hit $5.9 billion</a>. The company delivered nearly three times as many vehicles versus last year, mainly led by surging demand for Li Auto’s large, premium SUVs. Quarterly profit also doubled YOY and hit $810 million, capping a standout 2023 where Li Auto generated its first-ever annual profit.</p><p>Bullishly looking ahead, management issued rosy guidance for 2024 in its recent earnings report. In addition, Li Auto plans to launch five brand new models this year, targeting up to 800,000 total vehicles sold. The company continued making progress in expanding its vehicle margins. Li Auto secured a strong vehicle margin of 22.7% — evidence that many other EV startups are failing to expand margins like Li can.</p><p>Li Auto confirmed in late December 2023 that it will start making deliveries of its newest electric vehicle product, the Li Mega multipurpose vehicle, in March 2024. When the company first unveiled the Li Mega EV at the Guangzhou Auto Show last year, Li Auto said the EV would cost consumers less than 600,000 Chinese Yuan ($84,500) and that it already received 10,000 reservations within the first two hours of reservations opening.</p><p>I am very bullish about Li Auto’s prospects, expecting it to accelerate much further in the quarters ahead. While Li Auto does not sell many vehicles in the U.S. yet, it can make significant inroads into European countries soon. With strong growth trends, reasonable valuation multiples and a robust EV product pipeline, Li Auto warrants a spot in growth-oriented portfolios — especially those looking to capitalize on coming Fed rate cuts.</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading">United Airlines (UAL)</h2><div id="1399883" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/ual1600-300x169.jpg" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt='The side of a United Airlines (UAL) plane with "united" written above passenger windows. Represents airline stocks. Rate Cut Stocks' class="alignright wp-image-1399883" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/ual1600-300x169.jpg 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/ual1600-768x432.jpg 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/ual1600-1024x576.jpg 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/ual1600-200x113.jpg 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/ual1600-400x225.jpg 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/ual1600-116x65.jpg 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/ual1600-100x56.jpg 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/ual1600-89x50.jpg 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/ual1600-78x44.jpg 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/ual1600.jpg 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source: travelview / Shutterstock.com</div></div><p>Airline companies were arguably the hardest hit during the Covid-19 pandemic, racking up significant amounts of debt still left unpaid. These companies suffered tremendously in subsequent years, with the pain still ongoing despite a travel boom providing some lift. Even with higher demand, <a class="auto-linked-term" href="https://investorplace.com/industries/consumer-discretionary/travel/airline/">airline stocks</a> have struggled to take off given lofty interest rates worldwide — causing heightened pain in servicing all the accumulated debt.</p><p>For example, <strong>United Airlines</strong> (NASDAQ:<span class="stock-ticker"><a href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/ual-stock-quote/"><strong><u>UAL</u></strong></a></span>) is <a href="https://tradingeconomics.com/ual:us:interest-expense-on-debt" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener nofollow">spending around $450 million per quarter</a> on interest expenses alone. On the other hand, the company <a href="https://www.google.com/finance/quote/UAL:NASDAQ" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener nofollow">generated $600 million</a> in quarterly net income in Q4. With rates set to decline, I believe United can free up significant cash in the coming quarters.</p><p>The stock already trades at a bargain 4.7x forward earnings. The airline recently forecasted $9 to $11 in EPS this year, with analysts predicting big jumps in future profits. Projections call for 2026 EPS to soar above $14 — all while the stock languishes around $45 currently. I see sizable upside from today’s levels as rate cuts bolster United’s earnings power.</p><p>The entire airline industry should experience multiple expansion in a lower-rate environment. And value-priced carriers like United Airlines stand to benefit most as earnings get an added boost from lower interest costs.</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading">Aehr Test Systems (AEHR)</h2><div id="1408358" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/semiconductor1600b-300x169.jpg" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt="In Ultra Modern Electronic Manufacturing Factory Design Engineer in Sterile Coverall Holds Microchip with Gloves and Examines it. Semiconductor stocks to sell. Rate Cut Stocks" class="alignright wp-image-1408358" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/semiconductor1600b-300x169.jpg 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/semiconductor1600b-768x432.jpg 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/semiconductor1600b-1024x576.jpg 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/semiconductor1600b-200x113.jpg 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/semiconductor1600b-400x225.jpg 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/semiconductor1600b-116x65.jpg 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/semiconductor1600b-100x56.jpg 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/semiconductor1600b-89x50.jpg 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/semiconductor1600b-78x44.jpg 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/semiconductor1600b.jpg 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source: Shutterstock</div></div><p>As a smaller semiconductor equipment supplier, <strong>Aehr Test Systems</strong> (NASDAQ:<span class="stock-ticker"><a href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/aehr-stock-quote/"><strong><u>AEHR</u></strong></a></span>) is at higher risk than larger-cap alternatives. However, I also see massive upside potential in AEHR once rate cuts take hold at full force.</p><p>A sizable chunk of Aehr’s sales stems from the electric vehicle industry, as the company produces key testing equipment for EV chips and sensors. Due to high interest rates putting a damper on EV sales volumes lately, Aehr stock has sunk 68% from its September 2023 peak. However, I expect a sharp rebound once EV sales pick back up.</p><p>Recent order activity backs up my bullish thesis. Aehr recently <a href="https://seekingalpha.com/news/4069720-aehr-secures-23m-in-new-follow-on-orders" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener nofollow">secured $23 million</a> in new follow-on orders, pointing to strong customer demand. Moving forward, analysts forecast over 30% annual EPS growth. Yet the stock trades at just 22x forward earnings — a cheap multiple given the sizable growth anticipated.</p><p>As rate cuts spark an acceleration in the entire EV ecosystem, I expect Aehr Test Systems to be a major beneficiary. AEHR should deliver outsized returns as monetary policy pivots to supporting economic growth once again.</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading">PayPal (PYPL)</h2><div id="2633551" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/pypl1600-300x169.png" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt="Closeup of the PayPal app icon seen on a Google Pixel smartphone. PayPal Holdings, Inc. (PYPL) is a global financial technology company operating an online payment system. Rate Cut Stocks" class="alignright wp-image-2633551" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/pypl1600-300x169.png 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/pypl1600-1024x576.png 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/pypl1600-768x432.png 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/pypl1600-1536x864.png 1536w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/pypl1600-200x113.png 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/pypl1600-400x225.png 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/pypl1600-116x65.png 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/pypl1600-100x56.png 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/pypl1600-89x50.png 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/pypl1600-78x44.png 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/pypl1600.png 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source: Tada Images / Shutterstock.com</div></div><p>I believe <strong>PayPal</strong> (NASDAQ:<span class="stock-ticker"><a href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/pypl-stock-quote/"><strong><u>PYPL</u></strong></a></span>) offers one of the best values in the entire market. Investors buying at today’s prices should be richly rewarded in the next 24 months, if not sooner, as the value proposition becomes clearer. The entire fintech space stays deeply undervalued, with PayPal standing out as the largest player. This household name wields tremendous global reach and has delivered consistent revenue and profit growth, bouncing back strongly from its post-Covid-19cooldown.</p><p>However, Wall Street fixates on one metric here — active user counts. While that tally has stagnated and recently turned negative, I don’t view it as a big enough problem to justify bargain basement pricing over the past two years. PayPal’s user base may have shrunk, but it’s squeezing more sales and profits from retained users as their transaction volumes climb. PayPal retains a sticky user base poised to drive nearly 8% <a href="https://seekingalpha.com/symbol/PYPL/earnings/estimates" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener nofollow">annual EPS and revenue growth going forward</a> — strong for a fintech firm.</p><p>It bought back $5 billion in stock last year. It also beat Q4 EPS estimates by 8.6% and revenue estimates by 2.6%, yet still no re-rating. Impressively, its net margin expanded 40% year-over-year to 17.5% last quarter. I believe PYPL looks criminally undervalued at around $60 per share — rate cuts should stimulate digital transactions and significantly more upside.</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading">Vestas Wind Systems (VWDRY)</h2><div id="1984875" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/wind_turbine_1600-300x169.jpg" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt="A wind turbine appears in silhouette against a bright orange and blue sky." class="alignright wp-image-1984875" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/wind_turbine_1600-300x169.jpg 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/wind_turbine_1600-1024x576.jpg 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/wind_turbine_1600-768x432.jpg 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/wind_turbine_1600-1536x864.jpg 1536w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/wind_turbine_1600-200x113.jpg 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/wind_turbine_1600-400x225.jpg 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/wind_turbine_1600-116x65.jpg 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/wind_turbine_1600-100x56.jpg 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/wind_turbine_1600-89x50.jpg 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/wind_turbine_1600-78x44.jpg 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/wind_turbine_1600.jpg 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source: Khanthachai C / Shutterstock.com</div></div><p><strong>Vestas Wind Systems</strong> (OTCMKTS:<span class="stock-ticker"><a href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/vwdry-stock-quote/"><strong><u>VWDRY</u></strong></a></span>) is an offshore wind company. It has struggled the past two years as renewable energy got placed on the back burner — but I don’t expect that to persist forever. Down 46% from its peak, Vestas financials are recovering strongly. Its <a href="https://www.google.com/finance/quote/VWDRY:OTCMKTS" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener nofollow">Q3 net income of $148 million</a> turned 2023 profitable again, with $77 million in full-year profits.</p><p>Despite razor-thin 1.5% margins and ongoing industry headwinds, Vestas grew revenue and earnings in 2023. It achieved a record 18.4 GW order intake last year and aims to build on that momentum in 2024. Its Power Solutions segment should strengthen dramatically in 2024, while the Services segment remains a steady, non-cyclical grower.</p><p>Vestas holds a hefty $3.7 billion debt load equal to its cash position, compressing profitability and margins via interest expenses. But sustained rate cuts coupled with Europe’s desire to wean itself off Russian oil and gas could massively improve margins over a multi-year frame. That would unlock substantial share price upside. With asset values and earnings power skewed by high rates, Vestas should catch a bid as policy pivots to economic stimulus.</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading">Riot Platforms (RIOT)</h2><div id="2394468" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600-300x169.png" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt="In this photo illustration, the Riot Platforms (RIOT) logo is displayed on a smartphone screen. Rate Cut Stocks" class="alignright wp-image-2394468" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600-300x169.png 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600-1024x576.png 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600-768x432.png 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600-1536x864.png 1536w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600-200x113.png 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600-400x225.png 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600-116x65.png 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600-100x56.png 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600-89x50.png 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600-78x44.png 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600.png 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source:  rafapress / Shutterstock.com</div></div><p><strong>Bitcoin</strong> (<span class="crypto-ticker"><a href="https://investorplace.com/cryptocurrency/btc-usd/"><strong><u>BTC-USD</u></strong></a></span>) keeps climbing thanks to spot ETFs and upcoming “halving” tailwinds. However, one overlooked catalyst is how rate cuts could supercharge further upside. By making traditional assets less rewarding, lower rates should stimulate investor demand for alternative stores of value like Bitcoin. Banks and hedge funds are already jumping in, so cuts would be rocket fuel.</p><p><strong>Riot Platforms</strong> (NASDAQ:<span class="stock-ticker"><a href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/riot-stock-quote/"><strong><u>RIOT</u></strong></a></span>) rapidly expands operations ahead of sector appreciation, stockpiling a trove of <a href="https://www.riotplatforms.com/riot-announces-january-2024-production-and-operations-updates/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener nofollow">7,648 Bitcoins</a> as of January. It recently <a href="http://riotplatforms.com/riot-announces-january-2024-production-and-operations-updates/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener nofollow">ordered 31,500 next-gen miners from <strong>MicroBT</strong></a> for $97.4 million. Riot’s early re-positioning for recovery provides leverage while Wall Street still fixates on halving headwinds. If Bitcoin runs, miners will follow. With mines scaling aggressively and its balance sheet gaining leverage to crypto, substantial upside exists for Riot.</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading">Under Armour (UA)</h2><div id="1406092" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/uaa1600-300x169.jpg" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt="under armour stock" class="alignright wp-image-1406092" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/uaa1600-300x169.jpg 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/uaa1600-768x432.jpg 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/uaa1600-1024x576.jpg 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/uaa1600-200x113.jpg 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/uaa1600-400x225.jpg 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/uaa1600-116x65.jpg 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/uaa1600-100x56.jpg 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/uaa1600-89x50.jpg 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/uaa1600-78x44.jpg 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/uaa1600.jpg 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source: 2p2play / Shutterstock.com</div></div><p><strong>Under Armour</strong> (NYSE:<span class="stock-ticker"><a href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/ua-stock-quote/"><strong><u>UA</u></strong></a></span>) develops and distributes athletic apparel and accessories, may not be as rate-sensitive as other picks here. However, it can still deliver outsized returns as discretionary markets awaken. Lower rates should stimulate apparel spending. After years of stagnation, the stock rallied 25% off its November lows as Under Armour lifted profit guidance.</p><p>Long-term expectations call for robust growth. EPS is <a href="https://seekingalpha.com/symbol/UA/earnings/estimates" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener nofollow">forecast to double</a> from 49 cents in fiscal 2024 to $1 in fiscal 2027, making its forward P/E ratio just 8X three years out. Sales growth should also persist in the mid-single-digits over the next decade, combined with EPS expansion to drive 2033 EPS above $2.30 by estimates. If execution accelerates, Under Armour could realize even greater upside. It beat fiscal Q3 EPS estimates by 18%, proving it still has room to outperform.</p><p><em>On the date of publication, Omor Ibne Ehsan did not hold (either directly or indirectly) any positions in the securities mentioned in this article. articles.title: 7 Hypergrowth Stocks With Double-Your-Money Potential
summarizedBulletPoints: - **Riot Platforms (RIOT)** operates as a Bitcoin miner and holds significant potential amidst the crypto market's volatility. Despite the upcoming challenge of reduced mining rewards due to Bitcoin's halving event, Riot is aggressively expanding its operations and stockpiling Bitcoin in anticipation of price appreciation. The company reported holding 7,648 BTC as of January and has placed a sizeable order for 31,500 next-gen miners to enhance its mining capabilities, signaling strong positioning ahead of the sector's recovery. Trading at depressed levels compared to its peak, RIOT represents an attractive option for investors looking to capitalize on the potential surge in Bitcoin and associated mining activities. The focus on early strategic moves and leveraging its balance sheet in correlation with crypto trends may offer substantial upside for Riot Platforms as a key player in hypergrowth stocks within the cryptocurrency mining sector.
articles.desc: These hypergrowth stocks have the potential to double your money within just a couple of years if they keep executing.

"https:\/\/investorplace.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2024\/01\/hand-growth-stocks-1600.jpg",        "height": 900,        "width": 1600    },    "articleBody": "ACM Research\u00a0(ACMR): Semiconductor equipment maker poised for further upside. DraftKings\u00a0(DKNG): Market leader in online sports betting with substantial growth. P10\u00a0(PX): Private markets asset manager uniquely positioned to capitalize. Continue reading for the complete list of the hypergrowth stocks! Many investors are looking for companies that can deliver outsized returns. That’s why hypergrowth stocks remain attractive, especially ones with the potential to double your investment. When I look for hypergrowth stocks, I’m targeting businesses with massive addressable markets and competitive advantages that support rapid expansion. These companies are still early in their growth cycle, yet generate tremendous revenue growth annually. As they scale efficiently, profitability often follows. Tech stocks tend to fit this mold, leveraging innovation and strong network effects. We’ve witnessed many tech leaders generate life-changing wealth creation in recent decades. With digital transformation accelerating across industries, I expect new market leaders to emerge this decade. However, one must be prudent, as dilution can erode returns on hypergrowth stocks’ funding expansion. I prefer businesses nearing or achieving profitability through organic growth alone. The healthiest ones increase value for shareholders while self-funding growth initiatives. Let’s have a look! ACM Research (ACMR) Source: Pavel Kapysh \/ Shutterstock.comACM Research (NASDAQ:ACMR) is a semiconductor equipment manufacturer that provides innovative solutions for cleaning and improving product yield in fabricating integrated circuits or chips. As I’ve written previously, I would usually remain cautious about the overhyped semiconductor sector. However, ACMR has lagged other semiconductor stocks until its recent breakout. I highlighted ACMR’s strong upside potential despite trading below most semiconductor peers in my June, July and August coverage. This conviction has paid off handsomely for those who followed my buy recommendations (up 120%-plus). ACMR recently surged 40% more on a big earnings beat, with EPS topping estimates by 150% and revenue beating by over 14%. With numbers like these, I expect more upside in the coming quarters. ACMR’s specialty is enhancing the worldwide manufacturing process and yield for integrated chips. Their single-wafer wet cleaning equipment drives superior performance and efficiency. As chips become more complex, the need for innovative cleaning solutions only grows. ACMR is poised to capture share in this essential market. DraftKings (DKNG) Source: T. Schneider \/ Shutterstock.comWhile the travel rebound has cooled and gambling stocks draw less attention outside events like the Super Bowl, I remain bullish on the long-term potential of sports betting names like DraftKings (NASDAQ:DKNG). Megatrends point to gambling’s rising popularity, especially among younger demographics. Moreover, expanded state legalization efforts continue gaining momentum with successful lobbying from gambling entities. The more states that legalize sports betting, the bigger DraftKings’ addressable market becomes. This momentum shows no signs of slowing. DraftKings grew Q4 revenue by 44% as it marches toward future profitability. Consensus predicts EPS reaching $2.90 in 2027, meaning DKNG trades at just 14x 2027 earnings — very inexpensive for the amount of growth. Buying before this EPS hypergrowth seems like a good idea. P10 (PX) Source: undefined undefined \/ Getty ImagesThe pullback has P10 (NYSE:PX) shares trading below $10. At 11x forward earnings with double-digit sales growth, I now see multibagger return potential over a multi-year timeframe. P10 is a leading private markets solutions provider in alternative asset management. Their mission provides differentiated access to investment solutions addressing diverse needs within private markets. P10’s revenue comprises solely management fees. The strong rally in equity markets over the last few months should give an improved outlook for P10’s new private equity fundraising. With the stock so inexpensive, many analysts predict triple-digit upside potential before year’s end. Buying P10 at these levels offers a chance to capitalize on the rebound in private markets ahead. I believe substantial upside lies ahead. Smartsheet (SMAR) Source: Vera Petrunina\/ShutterStock.comSmartsheet (NYSE:SMAR) is a leading cloud-based work execution platform connecting teams and organizations. Its no-code solution enables anyone to create customized workflows, automating processes and reporting. Although off 47% from peaks, Smartsheet still trades at a premium typical of high-growth SaaS firms. However, substantial upside remains as Smartsheet counts 80%+ of the Fortune 500 as customers. These sticky enterprise clients will likely expand Smartsheet usage considerably in the coming years as the product portfolio matures. Smartsheet already boasts 90% of the Fortune 100 with plenty of room to grow in massive addressable markets. Consensus predicts surging profitability ahead, with EPS potentially skyrocketing from an estimated 70 cents in FY2024 (ended January) to $5.7 in FY2033. Paired with ~15% annual expected revenue growth, Smartsheet at 6x forward sales seems attractively priced for a SaaS firm. With blue-chip customers and tremendous market opportunities ahead in digitizing work execution, I believe Smartsheet can double within 2-3 years. The growth story remains intact. Spire (SPIR) Source: T. Schneider \/ Shutterstock.comSpire Global (NYSE:SPIR) operates a constellation of over 110 nanosatellites, tracking maritime, aviation, weather and other global datasets. I’m bullish on space companies amidst a potential military space race between China, and the U.S. Satellite technology has become essential for communications, GPS targeting and more. While risky after a 90% decline from peaks and 65% net loss margins, Spire has substantial potential. Net margins improved 40% YOY in Q3 as 34% revenue growth continues. Breakeven approaches in 2025. At 2.5x forward sales with 30%-plus annual growth, Spire holds long-term promise. Its federal business offering satellite data insights to defense groups should see demand rise with geopolitical tensions. Spire’s satellite fleet is the second largest commercially. Though speculative, space sector tailwinds and Spire’s ramping growth make it an attractive bet on the expanding space economy. I believe substantial upside lies ahead. Its bleeding has slowed dramatically, and a first-of-its-kind space data platform still seems early in monetization. Potential seems enormous if execution steadies. Riot Platforms (RIOT) Source: rafapress \/ Shutterstock.comI’ve consistently highlighted Riot Platforms (NASDAQ:RIOT) despite crypto market volatility, given multiple 2024 catalysts and sentiment lags. Bitcoin (BTC-USD) has rebounded nicely while miners like Riot remained depressed. While lower mining rewards post-Bitcoin halving loom, Riot rapidly expands operations ahead of it while stockpiling Bitcoin before appreciation. Riot held 7,648 BTC as of January and recently ordered 31,500 next-gen miners from MicroBT for $97.4M. Riot’s early positioning for sector recovery provides upside while Wall Street fixation on halving headwinds persists. If Bitcoin runs higher, miners will follow. With mines rapidly expanding as Riot’s balance sheet gains leverage to crypto, substantial upside exists for this option in hypergrowth stocks. Betterware (BWMX) Source: nehophoto \/ Shutterstock.comThough lacking the top-line hypergrowth of other picks, Betterware’s (NASDAQ:BWMX) home\/kitchen organization offerings and dividend make it worthwhile. This choice in hypergrowth stocks trades at $17 with visible upside drivers. Betterware beat Q4 EPS estimates by 103% and revenue by 11%, with 34% more EPS growth expected in 2024. Once rates eventually relax, profits could achieve better-than-expected upside. Its 7% dividend yield also seems easily sustainable given present growth and leading industry positioning. Plus, it has a 4% Mexico market share, so Betterware has ample runway for expansion here. The 65% decline from its peak also means there’s significant potential for recovery once Betterware returns to form. On the date of publication, Omor Ibne Ehsan did not hold (either directly or indirectly) any positions in the securities mentioned in this article. He also has an interest in high-risk, high-reward investments such as cryptocurrencies and penny stocks. shutterstock.com/Lemonsoup14</p>									</figcaption>					</figure>							<div class="entry-content story">							<p>Many investors are looking for companies that can deliver outsized returns. That’s why hypergrowth stocks remain attractive, especially ones with the potential to double your investment.</p><p>When I look for hypergrowth stocks, I’m targeting businesses with massive addressable markets and competitive advantages that support rapid expansion. These companies are still early in their growth cycle, yet generate tremendous revenue growth annually. As they scale efficiently, profitability often follows.</p><p><a class="auto-linked-term" href="https://investorplace.com/industries/technology/">Tech stocks</a> tend to fit this mold, leveraging innovation and strong network effects. We’ve witnessed many tech leaders generate life-changing wealth creation in recent decades. With digital transformation accelerating across industries, I expect new market leaders to emerge this decade.</p><p>However, one must be prudent, as dilution can erode returns on hypergrowth stocks’ funding expansion. I prefer businesses nearing or achieving profitability through organic growth alone. The healthiest ones increase value for shareholders while self-funding growth initiatives. Let’s have a look!</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading">ACM Research (ACMR)</h2><div id="1536603" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/acmr-stock-1-300x169.jpg" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt="a magnifying glass enlarges the ACM logo on a website" class="alignright wp-image-1536603" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/acmr-stock-1-300x169.jpg 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/acmr-stock-1-768x432.jpg 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/acmr-stock-1-1024x576.jpg 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/acmr-stock-1-200x113.jpg 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/acmr-stock-1-400x225.jpg 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/acmr-stock-1-116x65.jpg 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/acmr-stock-1-100x56.jpg 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/acmr-stock-1-89x50.jpg 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/acmr-stock-1-78x44.jpg 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/acmr-stock-1.jpg 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source: Pavel Kapysh / Shutterstock.com</div></div><p><strong>ACM Research</strong> (NASDAQ:<span class="stock-ticker"><a href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/acmr-stock-quote/"><strong><u>ACMR</u></strong></a></span>) is a semiconductor equipment manufacturer that provides innovative solutions for cleaning and improving product yield in fabricating integrated circuits or chips. As I’ve written previously, I would usually remain cautious about the overhyped semiconductor sector. However, ACMR has lagged other <a class="auto-linked-term" href="https://investorplace.com/industries/technology/semiconductor/">semiconductor stocks</a> until its recent breakout.</p><p>I highlighted ACMR’s strong upside potential despite trading below most semiconductor peers in my June, July and August coverage. This conviction has paid off handsomely for those who followed my buy recommendations (up 120%-plus). ACMR recently surged 40% more on a <a href="https://www.google.com/search?client=opera-gx&q=nasdaq:acmr+financials&sourceid=opera&ie=UTF-8&oe=UTF-8&si=AKbGX_rmEVeGd4eGbBb6f_kccelQJ2RFjwhMZqa7lwpPNLpJe7EiQIrr808Xp6g6Mme3qq7TI0RGawlPJkodiLyTOKLP7XaBB_8EULNJbSGM0332IFMLdJ7dekTdJ0xaXJGbY3ddEcifNBRD-IDi5J4Lk1yo__U4jg%3D%3D&ictx=1&ved=2ahUKEwjOoPeK3dCEAxVGSmwGHaNqC0cQgMAEKAB6BAhqEAI#tctx=foccp" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener nofollow">big earnings beat</a>, with EPS topping estimates by 150% and revenue beating by over 14%. With numbers like these, I expect more upside in the coming quarters.</p><p>ACMR’s specialty is enhancing the worldwide manufacturing process and yield for integrated chips. Their single-wafer wet cleaning equipment drives superior performance and efficiency. As chips become more complex, the need for innovative cleaning solutions only grows. ACMR is poised to capture share in this essential market.</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading">DraftKings (DKNG)</h2><div id="2639458" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/dkng1600-300x169.png" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt="Person holding smartphone with logo of US sports betting company DraftKings Inc. (DKNG) on screen in front of website. Focus on phone display. Unmodified photo." class="alignright wp-image-2639458" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/dkng1600-300x169.png 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/dkng1600-1024x576.png 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/dkng1600-768x432.png 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/dkng1600-1536x864.png 1536w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/dkng1600-200x113.png 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/dkng1600-400x225.png 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/dkng1600-116x65.png 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/dkng1600-100x56.png 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/dkng1600-89x50.png 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/dkng1600-78x44.png 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/dkng1600.png 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source: T. Schneider / Shutterstock.com</div></div><p>While the travel rebound has cooled and gambling stocks draw less attention outside events like the Super Bowl, I remain bullish on the long-term potential of sports betting names like <strong>DraftKings</strong> (NASDAQ:<span class="stock-ticker"><a href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/dkng-stock-quote/"><strong><u>DKNG</u></strong></a></span>). Megatrends point to gambling’s rising popularity, especially among younger demographics.</p><p>Moreover, expanded state legalization efforts continue gaining momentum with successful lobbying from gambling entities. The more states that legalize sports betting, the bigger DraftKings’ addressable market becomes. This momentum shows no signs of slowing.</p><p>DraftKings <a href="https://www.google.com/finance/quote/DKNG:NASDAQ" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener nofollow">grew Q4 revenue by 44%</a> as it marches toward future profitability. Consensus predicts <a href="https://seekingalpha.com/symbol/DKNG/earnings/estimates" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener nofollow">EPS reaching $2.90 in 2027</a>, meaning DKNG trades at just 14x 2027 earnings — very inexpensive for the amount of growth. Buying before this EPS hypergrowth seems like a good idea.</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading">P10 (PX)</h2><div id="2649190" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/oversold-stocks-to-buy-300x169.jpg" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt="man in suit holding a tablet with graphic above showing oversold stocks to buy" class="alignright wp-image-2649190" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/oversold-stocks-to-buy-300x169.jpg 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/oversold-stocks-to-buy-1024x576.jpg 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/oversold-stocks-to-buy-768x432.jpg 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/oversold-stocks-to-buy-1536x864.jpg 1536w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/oversold-stocks-to-buy-200x113.jpg 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/oversold-stocks-to-buy-400x225.jpg 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/oversold-stocks-to-buy-116x65.jpg 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/oversold-stocks-to-buy-100x56.jpg 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/oversold-stocks-to-buy-89x50.jpg 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/oversold-stocks-to-buy-78x44.jpg 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/oversold-stocks-to-buy.jpg 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source: undefined undefined / Getty Images</div></div><p>The pullback has <strong>P10</strong> (NYSE:<span class="stock-ticker"><a href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/px-stock-quote/"><strong><u>PX</u></strong></a></span>) shares trading below $10. At <a href="https://seekingalpha.com/symbol/PX/earnings/estimates" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener nofollow">11x forward earnings with double-digit sales growth</a>, I now see multibagger return potential over a multi-year timeframe.</p><p>P10 is a leading private markets solutions provider in alternative asset management. Their mission provides differentiated access to investment solutions addressing diverse needs within private markets. P10’s revenue comprises solely management fees.</p><p>The strong rally in equity markets over the last few months should give an improved outlook for P10’s new private equity fundraising. With the stock so inexpensive, many analysts predict triple-digit upside potential before year’s end.</p><p>Buying P10 at these levels offers a chance to capitalize on the rebound in private markets ahead. I believe substantial upside lies ahead.</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading">Smartsheet (SMAR)</h2><div id="1791098" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/work_from_home_1600-300x169.jpg" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt="A photo of woman working on a computer at a desk in her home. work-from-home stocks" class="alignright wp-image-1791098" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/work_from_home_1600-300x169.jpg 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/work_from_home_1600-1024x576.jpg 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/work_from_home_1600-768x432.jpg 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/work_from_home_1600-1536x864.jpg 1536w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/work_from_home_1600-200x113.jpg 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/work_from_home_1600-400x225.jpg 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/work_from_home_1600-116x65.jpg 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/work_from_home_1600-100x56.jpg 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/work_from_home_1600-89x50.jpg 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/work_from_home_1600-78x44.jpg 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/work_from_home_1600.jpg 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source: Vera Petrunina/ShutterStock.com</div></div><p><strong>Smartsheet</strong> (NYSE:<span class="stock-ticker"><a href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/smar-stock-quote/"><strong><u>SMAR</u></strong></a></span>) is a leading cloud-based work execution platform connecting teams and organizations. Its no-code solution enables anyone to create customized workflows, automating processes and reporting. Although off 47% from peaks, Smartsheet still trades at a premium typical of high-growth SaaS firms.</p><p>However, substantial upside remains as Smartsheet counts 80%+ of the Fortune 500 as customers. These sticky enterprise clients will likely expand Smartsheet usage considerably in the coming years as the product portfolio matures.</p><p>Smartsheet already boasts 90% of the Fortune 100 with plenty of room to grow in massive addressable markets. Consensus predicts surging profitability ahead, with EPS potentially skyrocketing from an <a href="https://seekingalpha.com/symbol/SMAR/earnings/estimates" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener nofollow">estimated 70 cents in FY2024</a> (ended January) to $5.7 in FY2033. Paired with ~15% annual expected revenue growth, Smartsheet at 6x forward sales seems attractively priced for a SaaS firm.</p><p>With blue-chip customers and tremendous market opportunities ahead in digitizing work execution, I believe Smartsheet can double within 2-3 years. I’m bullish on space companies amidst a potential military space race between China, and the U.S. Satellite technology has become essential for communications, GPS targeting and more.</p><p>While risky after a 90% decline from peaks and 65% net loss margins, Spire has substantial potential. <a href="https://www.google.com/finance/quote/SPIR:NYSE" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener nofollow">Net margins improved 40% </a>YOY in Q3 as 34% revenue growth continues. <a href="https://seekingalpha.com/symbol/SPIR/earnings/estimates" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener nofollow">Breakeven approaches in 2025</a>.</p><p>At 2.5x forward sales with 30%-plus annual growth, Spire holds long-term promise. Its federal business offering satellite data insights to defense groups should see demand rise with geopolitical tensions. Spire’s satellite fleet is the second largest commercially.</p><p>Though speculative, space sector tailwinds and Spire’s ramping growth make it an attractive bet on the expanding space economy. I believe substantial upside lies ahead. Its bleeding has slowed dramatically, and a first-of-its-kind space data platform still seems early in monetization. 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source: nehophoto / Shutterstock.com</div></div><p>Though lacking the top-line hypergrowth of other picks, <strong>Betterware’s</strong> (NASDAQ:<span class="stock-ticker"><a href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/bwmx-stock-quote/"><strong><u>BWMX</u></strong></a></span>) home/kitchen organization offerings and dividend make it worthwhile. This choice in hypergrowth stocks trades at $17 with visible upside drivers.</p><p>Betterware beat Q4 EPS estimates by 103% and revenue by 11%, with <a href="https://seekingalpha.com/symbol/BWMX/earnings/estimates" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener nofollow">34% more EPS growth</a> expected in 2024. Once rates eventually relax, profits could achieve better-than-expected upside. Its 7% dividend yield also seems easily sustainable given present growth and leading industry positioning. </p><p>Plus, it has a 4% Mexico market share, so Betterware has ample runway for expansion here. The 65% decline from its peak also means there’s significant potential for recovery once Betterware returns to form.</p><p><em>On the date of publication, Omor Ibne Ehsan did not hold (either directly or indirectly) any positions in the securities mentioned in this article. articles.title: Forget Crypto, Try These 3 Blockchain Stocks Instead
summarizedBulletPoints: - Riot Blockchain (RIOT) focuses on Bitcoin mining aiming to be a top U.S. producer, planning technological upgrades and expansion despite challenging conditions due to the 2024 Bitcoin halving event.

- RIOT expects to triple its mining capacity in 2024, with a significant purchase of Bitcoin miners from MicroBT to boost its hash rate capacity to 38 EH/s, positioning it as one of the top cryptocurrency mining stocks in the U.S.

- Analyst consensus is a "Moderate Buy" for RIOT shares, with price targets suggesting an 11.6% upside potential, making it an attractive investment option for those looking to indirectly invest in Bitcoin through equities.
- RIOT profits not only from the appreciation of Bitcoin but also from mining fees, which adds to its attractiveness as an investment.
articles.desc: Discover how investing in blockchain stocks over crypto could lead to significant gains. Find out which companies are making strides.

Blockchain Stocks Instead",    "datePublished": "2024-02-29T11:28:00-05:00",    "dateModified": "2024-02-29T12:07:48-05:00",    "image": {        "@type": "ImageObject",        "url": "https:\/\/investorplace.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2019\/12\/blockchain.jpg",        "height": 900,        "width": 1600    },    "articleBody": "Dive into blockchain stocks for potential high returns. Riot Blockchain (RIOT): Rio is aiming to be a top U.S. Bitcoin producer with expansion plans. Block (SQ): Improved profit guidance and significant Bitcoin investment really help Block. Visa (V): Visa has made strong financial growth with blockchain investments since 2016. Investing in blockchain stocks over cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin (BTC-USD) can be more of a speculative option. It can lead to higher overall returns. I see investing in blockchain stocks as a kind of synthetic leverage. It offers the potential to amplify both gains and losses for investors. While investing in cryptocurrencies exposes investors to certain risks, the risks of investing in blockchain stocks are wider. Investors need to worry about company-specific, market, and idiosyncratic risks that aren't present in the broader crypto markets. However, those same risks are also balanced by a proportionate upside. Most blockchain stocks carry a large amount of crypto on their balance sheets. They also have operating segments that totally depend on the health and performance of the industry. So when Bitcoin rises, too does the valuation of these companies, all else being equal. However, blockchain stocks may get earnings from other operating segments as well. This can improve their intrinsic value and thus be worth more in the long-run. Additionally, it's very possible these companies may pay dividends in the future. Thus, buying these companies now while they're still relatively inexpensive could lead to a much lower cost basis in the future. I think that investing in blockchain stocks could be a good move as we gear up for the climax of this year's crypto rally. Here are three companies to consider. Riot Blockchain (RIOT) Source: rafapress \/ Shutterstock.comRiot Blockchain (NASDAQ:RIOT) focuses on Bitcoin mining. It aims to be a leading Bitcoin producer in the U.S. with plans for technological upgrades and expansion. For this year, the company has ambitious expansion plans despite expectations of a challenging environment. This is due to the 2024 Bitcoin halving event, which is anticipated to halve Bitcoin production. Nonetheless, the company is expected to triple its mining capacity in 2024. Thus, it still believes the price of the asset will be accretive for investors. Framing this effort is that in June 2023, Riot entered into a long-term purchase agreement with MicroBT. Riot ordered 33,280 Bitcoin miners for the Corsicana Facility, with another order of 66,560 Bitcoin miners announced in December 2023. Once all of RIOT's miners have been deployed, it will have a total hash rate capacity of 38 EH\/s. This makes it one of the top cryptocurrency mining stocks in the United States. The consensus among analysts is to “Moderate Buy” RIOT shares. Price targets suggest an upside potential of 11.6% from the current price. However, I think it's one of those blockchain stocks to buy. Owning shares of it could be the closest thing equity investors can get to owning actual Bitcoin. Remember, RIOT also profits from Bitcoin mining fees as well, which makes it an attractive option. Block (SQ) Source: Sergei Elagin \/ Shutterstock.comBlock (NYSE:SQ) operates Cash App and payment processing for businesses. The company has also invested significantly in Bitcoin and is developing crypto technology through its team, Spiral. I think that SQ stock could be a great pick this year, as it recently improved its guidance. The company has raised its full-year profit guidance by more than $200 million, forecasting earnings of at least $2.63 billion, marking a growth of at least 15% from the previous year. For Q1 2024, Block anticipates adjusted core earnings between $570 million and $590 million, surpassing analysts’ expectations of $511.76 million. Despite a net loss of $0.02 per share in the latest quarter, the company’s revenue surged by 24% to $5.77 billion in Q4, with a significant portion excluding Bitcoin revenue. Wall Street analysts have a “Strong Buy” consensus on Block, with 32 analysts recommending a “Moderate Buy.” The average price target for SQ shares is $82.44, suggesting a potential upside of 5.1% from the current price. Cash App has 55 million monthly active users, many of whom are experienced and familiar with FinTech by the nature of the app, and more are being exposed to the ecosystem every quarter. Furthermore, on an EPS basis, analysts expect to see an incredible leap from 0.02 in FY2023 to 3.15 in FY2024; that’s a 15,640.67% increase!  Projections like these can't be ignored, and this is why SQ is one of those blockchain stocks to consider. Visa (V) Source: Kikinunchi \/ Shutterstock.comVisa (NYSE:V) has invested in blockchain since 2016, developing technologies like Visa B2B Connect for cross-border payments and Visa Fintech Fast Track for crypto wallets.  The company kicked off its fiscal year 2024 on a strong note with significant financial growth. In the first quarter of 2024, the company reported a 9% increase in net revenues, reaching $8.6 billion. This growth was driven by an 8% rise in payment volumes and a 16% surge in cross-border volume, excluding intra-Europe transactions. Analysts remain optimistic about Visa’s performance, predicting steady growth. For the fiscal year 2024, earnings per share (EPS) estimates average $9.92, with forecasts for 2025 rising to $11.16. Revenue predictions also reflect positive growth, with an average estimate of $35.86 billion for 2024, escalating to $39.59 billion in 2025. Visa is simply one of those stocks that offer great value for investors, and its short-term results and outlook make it one of those blockchain stocks investors should pay attention to moving forward. On the date of publication, Matthew Farley did not have (either directly or indirectly) any positions in the securities mentioned in this article. The opinions expressed are those of the writer, subject to the InvestorPlace.com Publishing Guidelines. Matthew started writing coverage of the financial markets during the crypto boom of 2017 and was also a team member of several fintech startups. He then started writing about Australian and U.S. equities for various publications. Shutterstock</p>									</figcaption>					</figure>							<div class="entry-content story">							<p>Investing in blockchain stocks over cryptocurrencies like <strong>Bitcoin </strong>(<span class="crypto-ticker"><a href="https://investorplace.com/cryptocurrency/btc-usd/"><strong><u>BTC-USD</u></strong></a></span>) can be more of a speculative option. It can lead to higher overall returns. I see investing in blockchain stocks as a kind of synthetic leverage. It offers the potential to amplify both gains and losses for investors.</p><p>While investing in cryptocurrencies exposes investors to certain risks, the risks of investing in blockchain stocks are wider. Investors need to worry about company-specific, market, and idiosyncratic risks that aren’t present in the broader crypto markets. However, those same risks are also balanced by a proportionate upside. Most blockchain stocks carry a large amount of crypto on their balance sheets. They also have operating segments that totally depend on the health and performance of the industry. So when Bitcoin rises, too does the valuation of these companies, all else being equal.</p><p>However, blockchain stocks may get earnings from other operating segments as well. This can improve their intrinsic value and thus be worth more in the long-run. Additionally, it’s very possible these companies may pay dividends in the future. Thus, buying these companies now while they’re still relatively inexpensive could lead to a much lower cost basis in the future.</p><p>I think that investing in blockchain stocks could be a good move as we gear up for the climax of this year’s crypto rally. Here are three companies to consider.</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading">Riot Blockchain (RIOT)</h2><div id="2394468" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600-300x169.png" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt="In this photo illustration, the Riot Platforms (RIOT) logo is displayed on a smartphone screen." class="alignright wp-image-2394468" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600-300x169.png 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600-1024x576.png 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600-768x432.png 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600-1536x864.png 1536w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600-200x113.png 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600-400x225.png 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600-116x65.png 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600-100x56.png 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600-89x50.png 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600-78x44.png 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600.png 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source:  rafapress / Shutterstock.com</div></div><p><strong>Riot Blockchain</strong> (NASDAQ:<span class="stock-ticker"><a href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/riot-stock-quote/"><strong><u>RIOT</u></strong></a></span>) focuses on Bitcoin mining. It aims to be a leading Bitcoin producer in the U.S. with plans for technological upgrades and expansion.</p><p>For this year, the company has ambitious expansion plans despite expectations of a challenging environment. This is due to the 2024 Bitcoin halving event, which is anticipated to halve Bitcoin production. Nonetheless, the company <a href="https://seekingalpha.com/article/4619872-riot-platforms-ambitious-expansion-to-be-overshadowed-by-2024-bitcoin-halving" rel="nofollow">is expected to triple</a> its mining capacity in 2024. Thus, it still believes the price of the asset will be accretive for investors.</p><p>Framing this effort is that in June 2023, Riot entered into a <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/riot-announces-january-2024-production-140000415.html" rel="nofollow">long-term purchase agreement</a> with <strong>MicroBT</strong>. Riot ordered 33,280 Bitcoin miners for the Corsicana Facility, with another order of 66,560 Bitcoin miners announced in December 2023. Once all of RIOT’s miners have been deployed, it will have a total hash rate capacity of 38 EH/s. This makes it one of the top cryptocurrency mining stocks in the United States.</p><p>The consensus among analysts is to “<a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/RIOT/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener nofollow">Moderate Buy</a>” RIOT shares. Price targets suggest an upside potential of 11.6% from the current price. However, I think it’s one of those blockchain stocks to buy. Owning shares of it could be the closest thing equity investors can get to owning actual Bitcoin. Remember, RIOT also profits from Bitcoin mining fees as well, which makes it an attractive option.</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading">Block (SQ)</h2><div id="2194362" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/sq-block-1600-300x169.png" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt="Square, Inc. changes name to Block (SQ). Smartphone with Square logo on screen in hand on background of Block logo." class="alignright wp-image-2194362" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/sq-block-1600-300x169.png 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/sq-block-1600-1024x576.png 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/sq-block-1600-768x432.png 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/sq-block-1600-1536x864.png 1536w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/sq-block-1600-200x113.png 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/sq-block-1600-400x225.png 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/sq-block-1600-116x65.png 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/sq-block-1600-100x56.png 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/sq-block-1600-89x50.png 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/sq-block-1600-78x44.png 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/sq-block-1600.png 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source: Sergei Elagin / Shutterstock.com</div></div><p><strong>Block</strong> (NYSE:<span class="stock-ticker"><a href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/sq-stock-quote/"><strong><u>SQ</u></strong></a></span>) operates Cash App and payment processing for businesses. The company has also invested significantly in Bitcoin and is developing crypto technology through its team, Spiral.</p><p>I think that SQ stock could be a great pick this year, as it recently improved its guidance. The company has raised its <a href="https://www.reuters.com/technology/payments-fintech-block-sees-q1-adjusted-core-earnings-above-estimates-2024-02-22/" rel="nofollow">full-year profit guidance</a> by more than $200 million, forecasting earnings of at least $2.63 billion, marking a growth of at least 15% from the previous year. For Q1 2024, Block anticipates adjusted core earnings between $570 million and $590 million, surpassing analysts’ expectations of $511.76 million. Despite a net loss of $0.02 per share in the latest quarter, the company’s revenue surged by 24% to $5.77 billion in Q4, with a significant portion excluding Bitcoin revenue.</p><p>Wall Street analysts have a <a href="https://www.wallstreetzen.com/stocks/us/nyse/sq/stock-forecast" rel="nofollow">“Strong Buy” consensus</a> on Block, with 32 analysts recommending a “Moderate Buy.” The average price target for SQ shares is $82.44, suggesting a potential upside of 5.1% from the current price.</p><p>Cash App has 55 million monthly active users, many of whom are experienced and familiar with FinTech by the nature of the app, and more are being exposed to the ecosystem every quarter. Furthermore, on an EPS basis, analysts expect to <a href="https://stockanalysis.com/stocks/sq/forecast/" rel="nofollow">see an incredible leap</a> from 0.02 in FY2023 to 3.15 in FY2024; that’s a 15,640.67% increase! </p><p>Projections like these can’t be ignored, and this is why SQ is one of those blockchain stocks to consider.</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading">Visa (V)</h2><div id="1629210" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/visa-1600-300x169.jpg" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt="several Visa branded credit cards" class="alignright wp-image-1629210" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/visa-1600-300x169.jpg 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/visa-1600-1024x576.jpg 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/visa-1600-768x432.jpg 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/visa-1600-1536x864.jpg 1536w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/visa-1600-200x113.jpg 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/visa-1600-400x225.jpg 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/visa-1600-116x65.jpg 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/visa-1600-100x56.jpg 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/visa-1600-89x50.jpg 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/visa-1600-78x44.jpg 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/visa-1600.jpg 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source: Kikinunchi / Shutterstock.com</div></div><p><strong>Visa</strong> (NYSE:<span class="stock-ticker"><a href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/v-stock-quote/"><strong><u>V</u></strong></a></span>) has invested in blockchain since 2016, developing technologies like Visa B2B Connect for cross-border payments and Visa Fintech Fast Track for crypto wallets. </p><p>The company kicked off its fiscal year 2024 on a <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/visa-inc-v-reports-9-213504594.html" rel="nofollow">strong note</a> with significant financial growth. In the first quarter of 2024, the company reported a 9% increase in net revenues, reaching $8.6 billion. This growth was driven by an 8% rise in payment volumes and a 16% surge in cross-border volume, excluding intra-Europe transactions.</p><p>Analysts <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/V/analysis/" rel="nofollow">remain optimistic</a> about Visa’s performance, predicting steady growth. For the fiscal year 2024, earnings per share (<strong>EPS</strong>) estimates average $9.92, with forecasts for 2025 rising to $11.16. Revenue predictions also reflect positive growth, with an average estimate of $35.86 billion for 2024, escalating to $39.59 billion in 2025.</p><p>Visa is simply one of those stocks that offer great value for investors, and its short-term results and outlook make it one of those blockchain stocks investors should pay attention to moving forward.</p><p><em>On the date of publication, Matthew Farley did not have (either directly or indirectly) any positions in the securities mentioned in this article. articles.title: Analyst Estimates: Here's What Brokers Think Of Riot Platforms, Inc. (NASDAQ:RIOT) After Its Yearly Report
summarizedBulletPoints: - Riot Platforms, Inc. (NASDAQ:RIOT) shareholders saw an 8.3% increase in the company’s shares after the latest full-year results were announced.
- The company reported revenues of US$281 million, which was slightly below forecasts by 2.7%.
- Statutory losses for Riot Platforms were reported at a per-share loss of US$0.28, significantly better than what analysts expected, representing a 71% smaller loss.
- Analysts have updated their earnings model for Riot Platforms, reflecting optimism despite the slight miss in revenue expectations.
- For the year 2024, analysts forecast Riot Platforms' revenues to be US$461.4 million, indicating a potential 64% growth in revenue compared to the last 12 months.
- The loss per share for 2024 is projected to increase to US$0.57, though this is an improvement over previous estimates.
- Analysts maintained a consensus price target of US$18.55 for Riot Platforms, suggesting that the updated loss per share forecast does not significantly change the company’s valuation.
- Analyst opinions on Riot Platforms' valuation vary widely, with the most bullish analyst setting a price target of US$26.00 per share and the most bearish analyst at US$11.00 per share.
- Riot Platforms is expected to outperform its industry, with forecasts suggesting a 64% annual revenue growth rate through the end of 2024, compared to 57% growth over the past five years.

- No major adjustments were made to the analysts' revenue forecasts post-earnings, but loss per share forecasts saw considerable improvement, indicating a more optimistic view on Riot Platforms' profitability.
- It’s highlighted that while short-term financials are important, the longer-term trajectory of Riot Platforms should be a crucial consideration for investors.
- Potential investment risks associated with Riot Platforms are acknowledged, including the identification of 3 warning signs, one of which raises significant concerns.
This summary focuses exclusively on the content related to Riot Platforms, Inc. (NASDAQ:RIOT) as per the provided instructions.
articles.desc:
It's been a good week for Riot Platforms, Inc. (NASDAQ:RIOT) shareholders, because the company has just released its latest full-year results, and the shares gained 8.3% to US$17.37. Revenues of US$281m came in a modest 2.7% below forecasts. Statutory losses were a relative bright spot though, with a per-share loss of US$0.28 coming in a substantial 71% smaller than what the analysts had expected. Following the result, the analysts have updated their earnings model, and it would be good to know whether they think there's been a strong change in the company's prospects, or if it's business as usual. Readers will be glad to know we've aggregated the latest statutory forecasts to see whether the analysts have changed their mind on Riot Platforms after the latest results.

View our latest analysis for Riot Platforms  earnings-and-revenue-growth

Taking into account the latest results, the consensus forecast from Riot Platforms' eleven analysts is for revenues of US$461.4m in 2024. This reflects a substantial 64% improvement in revenue compared to the last 12 months. Losses are forecast to balloon 193% to US$0.57 per share. Yet prior to the latest earnings, the analysts had been forecasting revenues of US$461.2m and losses of US$0.73 per share in 2024. Although the revenue estimates have not really changed Riot Platforms'future looks a little different to the past, with a considerable decrease in the loss per share forecasts in particular.

There's been no major changes to the consensus price target of US$18.55, suggesting that reduced loss estimates are not enough to have a long-term positive impact on the stock's valuation. Fixating on a single price target can be unwise though, since the consensus target is effectively the average of analyst price targets. As a result, some investors like to look at the range of estimates to see if there are any diverging opinions on the company's valuation. Currently, the most bullish analyst values Riot Platforms at US$26.00 per share, while the most bearish prices it at US$11.00. Note the wide gap in analyst price targets? This implies to us that there is a fairly broad range of possible scenarios for the underlying business.

Story continues

Of course, another way to look at these forecasts is to place them into context against the industry itself. The period to the end of 2024 brings more of the same, according to the analysts, with revenue forecast to display 64% growth on an annualised basis. That is in line with its 57% annual growth over the past five years. By contrast, our data suggests that other companies (with analyst coverage) in a similar industry are forecast to see their revenues grow 12% per year. So it's pretty clear that Riot Platforms is forecast to grow substantially faster than its industry.

The Bottom Line

The most obvious conclusion is that the analysts made no changes to their forecasts for a loss next year. Fortunately, they also reconfirmed their revenue numbers, suggesting that it's tracking in line with expectations. Additionally, our data suggests that revenue is expected to grow faster than the wider industry. There was no real change to the consensus price target, suggesting that the intrinsic value of the business has not undergone any major changes with the latest estimates.

Keeping that in mind, we still think that the longer term trajectory of the business is much more important for investors to consider. We have forecasts for Riot Platforms going out to 2025, and you can see them free on our platform here.

That said, it's still necessary to consider the ever-present spectre of investment risk.  We've identified 3 warning signs  with Riot Platforms (at least 1 which doesn't sit too well with us)  , and understanding these should be part of your investment process.

Have feedback on this article? Concerned about the content?Get in touch with us directly. Alternatively, email editorial-team (at) simplywallst.com.

articles.htmlContent:
Simply Wall St.

Analyst Estimates: Here's What Brokers Think Of Riot Platforms, Inc. (NASDAQ:RIOT) After Its Yearly Report

editorial-team@simplywallst.com (Simply Wall St)
February 27, 2024 at 11:01 AM·3 min read

It's been a good week for Riot Platforms, Inc. (NASDAQ:RIOT) shareholders, because the company has just released its latest full-year results, and the shares gained 8.3% to US$17.37. Revenues of US$281m came in a modest 2.7% below forecasts. Statutory losses were a relative bright spot though, with a per-share loss of US$0.28 coming in a substantial 71% smaller than what the analysts had expected. Following the result, the analysts have updated their earnings model, and it would be good to know whether they think there's been a strong change in the company's prospects, or if it's business as usual. Readers will be glad to know we've aggregated the latest statutory forecasts to see whether the analysts have changed their mind on Riot Platforms after the latest results.

View our latest analysis for Riot Platforms

Taking into account the latest results, the consensus forecast from Riot Platforms' eleven analysts is for revenues of US$461.4m in 2024. This reflects a substantial 64% improvement in revenue compared to the last 12 months. Losses are forecast to balloon 193% to US$0.57 per share. Yet prior to the latest earnings, the analysts had been forecasting revenues of US$461.2m and losses of US$0.73 per share in 2024. Although the revenue estimates have not really changed Riot Platforms'future looks a little different to the past, with a considerable decrease in the loss per share forecasts in particular.

There's been no major changes to the consensus price target of US$18.55, suggesting that reduced loss estimates are not enough to have a long-term positive impact on the stock's valuation. Fixating on a single price target can be unwise though, since the consensus target is effectively the average of analyst price targets. As a result, some investors like to look at the range of estimates to see if there are any diverging opinions on the company's valuation. Currently, the most bullish analyst values Riot Platforms at US$26.00 per share, while the most bearish prices it at US$11.00. Note the wide gap in analyst price targets? This implies to us that there is a fairly broad range of possible scenarios for the underlying business.

Of course, another way to look at these forecasts is to place them into context against the industry itself. The period to the end of 2024 brings more of the same, according to the analysts, with revenue forecast to display 64% growth on an annualised basis. That is in line with its 57% annual growth over the past five years. By contrast, our data suggests that other companies (with analyst coverage) in a similar industry are forecast to see their revenues grow 12% per year. So it's pretty clear that Riot Platforms is forecast to grow substantially faster than its industry.

The Bottom Line

The most obvious conclusion is that the analysts made no changes to their forecasts for a loss next year. Fortunately, they also reconfirmed their revenue numbers, suggesting that it's tracking in line with expectations. Additionally, our data suggests that revenue is expected to grow faster than the wider industry. There was no real change to the consensus price target, suggesting that the intrinsic value of the business has not undergone any major changes with the latest estimates.

Keeping that in mind, we still think that the longer term trajectory of the business is much more important for investors to consider. We have forecasts for Riot Platforms going out to 2025, and you can see them free on our platform here.

That said, it's still necessary to consider the ever-present spectre of investment risk. We've identified 3 warning signs with Riot Platforms (at least 1 which doesn't sit too well with us) , and understanding these should be part of your investment process.
